shareish_description: Shareish is an open-source web platform to foster mutual aid, and solidarity (also called generalized exchange or gift economy). On Shareish, everything is free, no real or virtual currency is used. Everyone is free to request or offer any material, manual, intellectual, logistical aid, and act in solidarity on a regular or occasional basis.
shareish_description2: where specific items (goods and services to give or to lend for free, requests for help, free events) can be viewed, added, and edited by registered users. Items can be geolocated so it is very easy to explore your neighbourdhood hence foster local mutual aid, at your street corner or in your area. Users can start conversations to get further details about an item/request or to arrange an appointment for the exchange. These items can also be viewed as a list where they can be easily sorted according to different criteria. External public data (such as free drinking water sources, public bookcases and gift boxes, falling fruits, ...) can also be displayed. Search mechanisms and AI methods can be used to ease search and encoding
terms_conditions: Terms, Conditions of Use, and Privacy Policy
faq_nothing: I have nothing to give/lend, can I still use Shareish ?
faq_nothing_answer: The short answer is: YES ! The long answer is: YES, first take some time and have a look at requests, maybe you can help someone right away ! If not, please note by receiving a free good or service from others, you potentially release them from their feeling of indebtedness as they were probably previously in the same situation than you are. Also consider that you might have items/skills in the future to give/lend, it is not an issue not to have right now, Shareish is promoting mutual aid, solidarity and indirect exchange over the long term. Anyway, please have a look at your belongings/skills, you might already have things/skills to share but you are not yet aware it might be useful for others (see next question) so feel free to reference them on the Shareish platform as others might be interested in the future. Also, if you are aware of free events (give-away, repair café, ...), feel free to encode them
faq_examples: Can you give examples of items we can create and find on Shareish ?
faq_examples_answer: Items can be offers (of goods or services), requests (of goods or services), loans (of goods), or free events, so the possibilities are many. Services include, for example, helping someone to move furniture, picking up or delivering groceries, driving them to a certain place, advising them when filling out an administrative document, walking their dog, help to clean up after a flood, ... In terms of goods, we can imagine lending or donating books, kitchen utensils, surplus vegetables from the garden, household appliances, games for kids, a blanket, clothes, protective masks , ... Events can be, for example, repair workshops by volunteers (Repair café), free solidarity meals, temporary free stores, ... The possibilities for mutual aid are endless!
terms_content: 1. Adding content to the platform: What can I share ?
terms_content_details: Users may offer to share any type of content provided that: - It is free of charge; - The content is not prohibited by law or contrary to public order or morality, and in particular that - it is not, notably, of a nature that is false, defamatory, insulting, misleading, offensive or obscene; - it does not infringe image rights or private life. All users must refrain from making any comments or content that is illegal, or that may cause any harm to a third party. By using Shareish, you acknowledge that no content made available by users of the platform is pre-screened, controlled or approved by the developers and managers of Shareish (hereinafter referred to as The Shareish team). The Shareish team shall have the right to refuse, remove or move any content available on a Shareish server, for a violation of the of the terms of use reported to it (via info@shareish.org), or, at its sole discretion, for any other reason. Under no circumstances shall the Shareish team be held responsible in any way whatsoever for the content present on the platform or for any loss or damage of any kind whatsoever resulting from the use of any content made available on or via a Shareish server.
faq_address: Are item adresses correct on Shareish ? If I'm interested by an item, can I go there and get it ?
faq_address_answer: The users who encode the elements themselves decide on the precision of the address they encode. Some users will reference the exact address, others a street name, district, city. In any case, it is recommended to start a conversation with a user of an item to find out the exact address and decide how to proceed with the sharing. For public elements (bookcases, give boxes, drinking water sources, etc.), the addresses are in principle verified by the OpenStreetMap and Falling Fruit communities but it is recommended to further inquire by clicking on the external link (for example some donation boxes are located in buildings that are not open 24 hours a day).
faq_notifications: How to activate/desactivate notifications when new content is available ?
faq_notifications_answer: You can set the frequency (instantly, daily, weekly, or desactivate) of e-mail notifications once new content is added to the platform in the parameters and settings of your account (see top-right menu)
faq_colors: What is the meaning of the colors of the items on the map?
faq_colors_answer: The colored markers allow you to identify elements added by Shareish users. The red position markers are requests, the green dots are offers (donation, proposals), the yellow dots are loan proposals, the purple dots are events, the blue dot indicates your detected position. In addition to these elements, you can display public data such as book and donation boxes, drinking water sources,... These public points are symbolized by icons (a book for a book box, a cabinet for a donation box, ...).
faq_device: Can I use Shareish on my computer, tablet or mobile phone? Is Shareish also available as an app?
faq_device_answer: Shareish is a website that can be viewed on these different devices. There is currently no mobile app but you can add Shareish to your homescreen on your smartphone or tablet: Use the 'add to homescreen' function in your browser.  We have not tested all combinations of equipments, browsers, operating systems, if you notice any bugs or display inconveniences, please contact us (see below)
faq_data_collection: 2. Platform privacy policy – Information and data collected: What is Shareish's privacy policy ? Which information does Shareish collect about me and for what purpose ?
faq_data_collection_answer: The data collected on the Shareish platform (https://shareish.org/) are recorded by the Institut Montefiore of the University of Liège in order to register you to the Shareish platform. Your data may be used to give you access to the platform services, to perform scientific research, and to allow students and researchers of the University to acquire and improve software development skills (in human-computer interaction, computer-supported cooperative work, and in machine learning). These data will be kept for the time of your registration to the platform. This data will be processed on the legal basis of contractual execution.  The service could not be provided without personally identifiable information that you voluntarily provide. We do require a basic level of data (an email address, a username, a password) so that you may then log in and receive notifications via email (when getting new messages or when new items are created on the platform by other users). Optionnaly, you can also provide additional information (such as other social networks profile) and your geographic location so that the Shareish web server can display items in your geographic area and sort them according to distance (but you are free to disable geolocalisation and you can decide the precision of your reference location in your profile Settings). In addition, Shareish saves the items you have viewed on the website (so that you can later only display unseen items), but this can be disabled in the Settings of your account. Shareish platform keep all functional data in a database as long as you have an active account, you can desactivate or delete your account in the Settings. These data will not be transmitted to third parties, with the exception of other users of the Shareish platform who will have access to certain data concerning you. Shareish web server does not utilize cookies (only session data are stored in your browser). Shareish uses the HTTPS protocol so that all communications between your browser and the Shareish web server are encrypted. In accordance with the provisions of the General Data Protection Regulation (UE 2016/679), you can exercise your rights regarding personal data (access, rectification, erasure, restriction to processing, data portability, objection) by contacting info@shareish.org or, otherwise, the ULiège Data Protection Officer (dpo@uliege.be - Mr. Data Protection Officer, Building B9 GDPR Cell, Quartier Village 3, Boulevard de Colonster 2, 4000 Liège, Belgium). You also have the right to lodge a complaint with the Data Protection Authority (https://www.dataprotectionauthority.be, contact@apd-gba.be)
faq_public_resources: I want to edit or add public resources (public bookcases, drinking water sources, falling fruits,...), how can I do it ?
faq_public_resources_answer: On Shareish you can display specific resources created by users (called individual items which are in general limited in time, such as a request for help) and other public resources (that are in general (semi-)permanent, such as drinking water sources, or public bookcases). Your specific items are stored in an internal Shareish database and directly editable on Shareish (from the map or in the Add Item menu), while public resources are retrieved from the open-access OpenStreetMap and FallingFruit databases, and indirectly editable. To add or edit public resources, we have added in our map user interface links to other website (MapComplete, OSM I-D, FallingFruit UI). To edit public resources, when you click on the map on it, we provide a link to the corresponding OpenStreetMap/MapComplete/FallingFruit node page where it is possible to edit it. To add a new public resource, right-click (or long press) on Shareish map to open a pop-up that offers links to third-party edit sites. In addition, please see below other existing editor tools that you could use to edit and add OpenStreetMap POI (points of interest) subsequently available on Shareish:
faq_how_to_contribute: How can I contribute to Shareish development ?
faq_how_to_contribute_answer: You can send us constructive comments/issues, remarks, ... (see last question). If you are a software developer, you are able to contribute to the source code (solve current issues or implement new features) available on GitHub (link in the page footer).  If you want to translate the website into your own language, it can be done by adding your translations into a publicly available CSV file on GitHub (see in frontend/src/locales/translations.csv) and trigger a pull request (or contact us). In any case, helping others and talking about the project around you is already a nice way to contribute !
faq_local_instance: Is is possible to launch my own Shareish server instance in my community/city ?
faq_local_instance_answer: Yes, as Shareish is fully open-source (permissive license, see https://github.com/shareish/shareish/blob/main/LICENSE) it can be reused for any purposes in a decentralized way. If you want to use Shareish within your community, area, city, region, or organization, you are free to install a Shareish web server following our deployment procedure available on GitHub, and also to modify the code to fit your specific needs. We can also create a free redirection from e.g. https://mycommunity.shareish.org/ to your website and list it here. Please note that the Shareish team is not liable for any content on any decentralized Shareish web server and that you must adapt the terms of use (content and confidentiality policy) of your web server in order to ensure compliance with the data protection rules for your server by yourself. If you are looking for collaboration or specific developments, feel free to contact us (see below last question).
faq_who_answer: The initial team is composed by researchers and students in computer science at the Montefiore Institute, University of Liège, Belgium. We are interested in human-computer interaction, computer-supported cooperative work, and machine learning. Since 2021, this platform has been designed in the context of postdoctoral research and graduation works (Master Thesis or Bachelor Internship). We share the idea modern technologies can be better used to foster mutual aid strategies and that such tools could be open-source to ease their deployment, control by user groups, reuse (replication), and improvement. A scientific paper accepted for publication in the proceedings of the 11th International Conference on Communities and Technologies (C&T 2023) describe our approach. We would be very happy if others joint and contribute to the project, if you are interested please contact us !
faq_further: I have further comments, issues, remarks, questions, proposals, where should I send them ?
faq_further_answer: Constructive comments are very welcome and we are open to new ideas as we would like the development of Shareish to be participatory. See our Contact links below to report bugs using GitHub issues or to discuss about the project using Github Discussions. Also feel free to send us an e-mail
help_signup: Basic information are required to create an account on Shareish. We suggest you to provide more detailed information in My Account after log in
help_add_item: An item can be of several types (request for good or service, offer for good or service, loan offer, event) but the encoding form is identical. If you want to encode data on public roads such as a public bookcase or a source of drinking water, it is best to use other existing tools for that, see our FAQ on the home page
help_item_type: Select the item type: a Request when you are looking for something (a good, or a service), Donation (a good you want to give, or skills you can provide for free), Loan for a good you can loan for free, Event for a free and solidarity event
help_item_ihaveimage: Choose this option if you are able to upload an image that represents the item you want to add (e.g. a picture of a book). It will help others to identify what is your item. Also, the image will be analyzed by an AI algorithm that will try to fill some of the fields to describe your items to ease encoding (e.g. the author and title of the book in the Description field)
help_item_noimage: Choose this option if you don't have an image for your item (images are optional and can be uploaded later)
help_item_category: Choose 1 to 3 categories describing your item that will help other users to quickly search about relevant items
it: Computers, Multimedia, and Network and Communication Hardware
house: Living spaces, housing, and home furnitures
choose_add_content_type_map: Choose which type of content you want to add here:
add_ffruit: A public edible fruit or plant (Location on Falling Fruit):
add_item: A gift, loan, request, or event (Shareish):
add-new-item-from-recurrents: Add a new item from recurrents
i-have-image: I have image for my item
i-do-not-have-image: I don't have image for my item
help_item_name: Name or short title of your item. An AI algorithm suggests a name if you uploaded an item picture but you can edit it to make it more sound.
drop-or-click-to-upload: Drop your files here or click to upload
no-uploaded-images: No images have been uploaded yet.
name: Name
help_item_address: Enter the address of the item (where it is offered/requested, optional but strongly recommended). You can click on the localization button to copy your current geolocalization and edit it if necessary. The more precise the address, the better, but you can discard some details for privacy, e.g. use either streetname with or without the street number, the city or area name.
help_item_description: Describe as precisely as possible your item. E.g. if it is a good, you might add brand/model/sizes/year/... and what it can be useful for. If this is a request for service, try to be as precise as possible about the required work and estimated duration. This field is sometimes pre-filled by an AI algorithm based on the uploaded image but you can edit it.
help_item_start_date: Enter a different start date (by default it is now) if your item is not yet available/applicable
help_item_end_date: Enter an end date if your item is valid for a limited period of time (e.g. expiration date for food, or period during which you wish to be helped), otherwise leave this field empty
help_item_recurrent: Save this item in your profile so you can later add it again without re-encoding everything (e.g. if you regularly have apples to give at a specific time each year)
help_biography: Describe yourself, your hobbies, your motivation, anything else you want to share... This helps others to better know you.
help_homepage: Type the URL of your website if any
help_facebook: Type the URL of your Facebook account if any
help_instagram: Type the URL of your Instagram account if any
help_ref_location: Address (optional but recommended) to define your neighbordhood, so typically this is your home address.  You can click on the localization button to update it based on your current geolocation. The more precise, the better, but you can discard some details, e.g. you can use either streetname with or without the street number, the city or area name. This information is not visible for others and only used when sending notifications by e-mail.
help_dwithin: Size of your neighborhood of interest (in kilometers) to get notifications (small value means you will only get notifications for activities in a small area around your reference address)
help_email: Type your e-mail address (mandatory, one account only per e-mail address)
help_notif_conversations: Tell us how frequently should we notify you from new conversations and messages
help_notif_items: Tell us how frequently we should notify you from new items being published
help_notif_events: Tell us how frequently we should notify you from new events being published

messages.email: Must be a valid email address

notif-success-user-update: Your account has been updated successfully
notif-error-user-update: An error prevented your account to be updated
notif-error-send-message: An error prevented your message to be sent
intro-DN-first-message: Hello, thank you for your donation proposal. I am interested for ...
intro-RQ-first-message: Hello, I think I can answer your request. I can ...
intro-LN-first-message: Hello, thank you for your loan proposal. I am interested for ...
intro-EV-first-message: Hello, thank you for making this event possible. I am interested to participate.
help_avatar: Upload an image that represents you
notif-error-item-delete: An error prevented the item to be deleted
notif-error-user-login: The username or the password is invalid, or your account is not activated yet (check your emails).
notif-success-user-sign-up: Your account has been created. Check your emails to activate it.
notif-error-user-sign-up: The username or the email is already taken.
notif-error-email-activation: Something went wrong during email activation
notif-success-email-activation: Your email address has been activated successfully, you can now log in !
notif-success-resend-activation: A new activation link has been sent to your email address
notif-error-resend-activation: Something went wrong during sending of activation link
notif-success-password-reset-sent: Check your emails to continue the password reset procedure
notif-error-password-reset-sent: An error prevented to reset your password.
notif-error-password-reset: An error prevented to change your password.
notif-success-item-update: The item has been successfully edited
item-image-info: Only upload image to replace existing one.
conversations-reloaded-successfully: Conversations got reloaded successfully after last error!
notifications-reloaded-successfully: Notifications got reloaded successfully after last error!
item-not-available-anymore-warning: This item is not available anymore. This page is still accessible for information purpose.
item-not-available-anymore-warning-owner: Your item is not available anymore. This page is still accessible for information purpose.
enable-geolocation-to-use-feature: You must enable geolocation to use this feature.
too-many-images-selected-to-upload: Too many images selected to upload. You can only upload {n} more.
max-images-uploaded-reached: You've reached the maximum amount of images allowed to be uploaded.
ask-fill-form-using-recurrents: Fill the form using one of your recurrent items?
want-an-other-recurrent: You are using item #{n}. Want to use an other one?
removing-picture-confirmation: Are you sure you want to remove this picture from your profile? This action cannot be undone.
info-already-uploaded-profile-pictures: If you have already uploaded profile pictures in the past, you can look through them and select one as your current profile picture. Just click on it!
info-no-profile-picture-uploaded-yet: You haven't uploaded any profile pictures yet.
info-profile-picture-recommendation: Using a profile picture is recommended as it helps other users to identify who they are interacting with and thus improve trust on the website. You can even upload several pictures!
aware-changes-not-saved: Aware! Your new profile picture needs to be saved!
image-already-profile-picture: This image is already your profile picture!
delete-message-confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this message from the conversation? This action cannot be undone.
delete-item-confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this item? This action cannot be undone.
notif-error-post-comment: An error prevented your comment to be posted
delete-comment-confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this comment? This action cannot be undone.
author: Author
no-categories-selected-for-search: No category filter applied. Select a category below to add it to the search!
use-reflocation: Use reference location from your user profile
set-a-reflocation-to-use-feature: You must set a reference location in your settings to use this feature.
map-settings-saved: Your map settings have been saved.
define-elements-to-see-on-map: Define which public resources (from OpenStreetMap & Falling Fruit) you want to display on the map.
this-item-doesnt-have-a-location: This item does not have a location, cannot show it on the map.
save-items-you-see: Authorize the recording of the items you see on Shareish
help_save-items-you-see: By default we record the items you see to allow you to filter out already seen items on the website (in the map and browse list) and to avoid sending e-mail notifications for already seen items
close-all-conv-from-item: Close all conversation from this item
close-all-conv-from-item-reversible: Conversations closed can still be re-opened later on.
item-linked-to-conv-unavailable-delted: The item linked to this conversation is unavailable or has been deleted.
this-conv-is-closed-textarea: This conversation is closed, you cannot send a message.
help_disable-your-account: This is a temporary action. You can still recover your account whenever you want.
help_delete-your-account: This is a permanent action. You won't be able to recover your account once it's deleted.
help_login-disabled-account: This account has been disabled and is not accessible anymore. If you want to recover it, please
help_login-scheduled-deletion-account: This account is scheduled for deletion and is not accessible anymore. There is {x} day(s) remaining before it gets deleted. If you want to recover it, please
help_recover-account: Recovering your account back will make it accessible again. Here is what will change:
continue-recover-account: If you still want to recover your account, please enter your account's email address or your username below.
notif-success-email-recover-account: An email containing a recovery link has been sent to the address associated to this account.
help_confirm-recover: By clicking on the button below you confirm that you want to recover your account {email} (@{username}) and make it accessible again on Shareish.
notif-success-account-recovering: Your account {email} ({username}) has been successfully recovered. You can now access it again.
notif-success-account-disabling: Your account have been successfully disabled.
if-still-want-to-x-your-account-password: If you still want to {x} your account, please enter your password:
danger-warning-delete-account: But once this 30 days delay is over, you won't ever be able to recover your data or your account.
about-to-x-your-account: You are about to {x} your account.
as-security-email-confirmation-delete: As a security, a link will be sent to your email address to confirm your choice.
if-delete-choice-confirmed-no-recover: Once confirmed, we will keep your data saved for 30 days in case you change your mind in order for you to be able to recover your account if necessary.
notif-success-account-deletion-process-l: A confirmation link to delete your account has been sent to your email address.
notif-success-start-account-deletion-pro: The deletion process has successfully started for you account. If you ever want to recover it before the due date, please try to log back in to your account and follow the instructions.
to-get-back-to-home: To get back the home page
help_start-account-deletion-process: By clicking on the button below you confirm that you want to start the process of deleting your account {email} (@{username}). Process that will delete all your data and your account in 30 days.
help_item_visibility__UL: Only visible for people you will share it with
help_item-close: By continuing, you will mark this item as closed. It won't be listed on Shareish anymore. You can use this option when your item has been donated, resolved, received or is now unavailable.
why-item-close: Why do you want to close this item?
close-option-DN-on-shareish: I donated this item on Shareish
close-option-RQ-on-shareish: I received this item on Shareish
close-option-LN-on-shareish: I lent this item on Shareish
close-option-EV-on-shareish: Shareish contributed to the organization of this event
close-option-DN-outside-shareish: I donated this item outside of Shareish
close-option-RQ-outside-shareish: I received this item outside of Shareish
close-option-LN-outside-shareish: I lent this item outside of Shareish
close-option-EV-outside-shareish: Shareish did not contributed to the organization of this event
close-option-EV-not: The event did not take place
help_definitive-deletion:
If you want to definitively delete this item, you can do so by clicking on the button below. This will completely delete the item from the Shareish platform.

Please, understand that this cannot be undone and that the deletion is permanent. If you want to keep your item on the platform but don't want the others users to see, you can do so by marking it as closed or private.
warning-item-is-closed: You have marked this item has closed.
notif-success-item-definitive-deletion: The item has been successfully permanently deleted.
notif-success-item-close: The item has been successfully marked as closed.
error_keys__ITEM_CLOSING_REASON_DOESNT_E: This item closing reason doesn't exist.
error_keys__MUST_BE_AUTHENTICATED: You must be authenticated to do this action.
error_keys__NOT_ACCOUNT_OWNER: You are not the owner of this account.
error_keys__NOT_IMAGE_OWNER: You are not the owner of this image.
error_keys__NOT_ITEM_OWNER: You are not the owner of this item.
error_keys__NOT_VALIDATED_YET: This account is not validated yet.
error_keys__SCHEDULED_DELETION_ACCOUNT: This account is scheduled for deletion and will be deleted soon.
error_keys__TOKEN_ACTION_BAD_FORMAT: Token action has a bad format.
terms_read_agree: I have read and I agree to
terms_conditions_privacy_policy: Shareish's Terms, Conditions, and Privacy Policy
report_bug: Report a bug or an issue
after_registration_settings: After registration, please go to your account page to configure more details and settings (including neighbourdhood notifications).
faq_falling_fruits_edit: To add falling fruits, the simplest way is to go on
faq_edit_public_account: To edit public resources on OSM, you will have to create an account on OpenStreetMap. On FallingFruit, you can either add anonymously or create an account. User account creation on these websites  can be done very easily
